Articles.Content:
I've finally got around to playing 1.9.1 and am happy to report no problems.  All mods carried over ok, so did my save file.

My main reason for writing is to express how happy I am with the removal of Time Warp limitations by altitude. It is so beautiful to finally be able to orbit Kerbin, Moho, Gilly, Dres, Duna, Vall without them! I really hated the limitations to be honest, never quite understood the technical reasons for them. They would put me off going to places, actually. Constantly having to switch to the Tracking Station just to orbit a little faster got really old. Not to mention the extra strain that put on memory management. So however you did it, we'll done, and thank you!

I know we're coming to the end of KSP v1 but I still wanted to tell you that you don't toil in obscurity and your continued work on KSP will always be appreciated. 

Cheers!

I agree the removal of time warp limitations were triple A addition.

Considering some recent grey area news for KSPv2 i think it has gotten some extended life before it ''ends''  .

Edited June 5, 2020 by Boyster
Time Warp limitations by altitude s u c k e d, and i'm glad they removed it
I’m very glad too, orbiting at golly was reallllllly slow lol
